newsitem.title: USA: IBM gain helps boost technology group.
newsitem.headline: IBM gain helps boost technology group.

text.p: A jump in the shares of International Business Machines Corp, ahead of its widely-anticipated first quarter earnings, was helping boost other big cap technology stocks, traders and analysts said.
Traders said a surge of short-covering fueled a gain in IBM on Wednesday, as some investors are now betting IBM may meet or even exceed the Wall Street consensus estimate.

IBM will report its first quarter earnings Wednesday after the close of the U.S. stock market. IBM rose 1-1/4 to 141-1/4 in active trading. Microsoft Corp was up 3-3/4 to 114-3/8 and Intel Corp cilmbed 2-7/8 to 143-3/4.
Compaq Computer Corp also rose 1-1/2 to 76-3/4 and Advanced Micro Devices rose 1-1/8 to 38-7/8.

"It's a flight to the quality big caps at this point," said one trader, adding that the sentiment about IBM's earnings is much improved, especially after a rash of rumors a few weeks ago, that IBM would miss the quarter.
"You had a feeding frenzy a few weeks ago; there was this whole thesis a few weeks ago that IBM was going to blow up and they weren't going to meet the number," the trader said.
According to First Call, the consensus estimate on IBM is $2.28 a share, with estimates ranging from $2.10 to $2.37.
